data.title: Best hot dogs ever!!!
data.text: I am not a big hot dog eater but theirs are fabulous. I have been there a couple of times & ordered the Kobe hot dog both times. There are multiple toppings to choose from & are all fresh & delicious. Really enjoy the chili & they melt the cheese so not falling off when you try to eat it. Doesn't get any better!! They have French fries or sweet potato fries, which could stand to be cooked a little longer, but are decent. They also have craft beer on tap. We will definitely be heading back a other time.

data.title: Great Hot Dogs and Beer!
data.text: There are so many combinations of hot dogs/sausages/toppings here. I didn't even know where to begin so I tried one that a saw on TripAdvisor a couple of times. Beef Dog, Chili, Cheese, and Mac & Cheese. So good!!

data.title: Soggy fried
data.text: My wife and I each had a sausage dog, it was good and enjoyable, however the French fries left a lot to be desired. They mixed the ones that had been under a heat lamp with new ones, they were all soggy, not impressed.

data.title: I'm not sure; overpriced or overrated.
data.text: I'm a fan of hotdogs. I'm a fan of expensive meals. I'm just not a fan of Botsky's. I tried a couple of different hotdogs and they were good but the price you pay for them you'd thing you where at a major league ballpark.

data.title: Creative hot dogs
data.text: Went here for my husband and ended up enjoying it myself!  The International dog has a good combination of things on it.  We tried the Alligator dog and it was good but spicy.

data.title: One of Lake Charles' best!
data.text: Love the different types of dogs and fries are outstanding as well.  The hardest part is making the decision of what to order today!  Some unique and interesting toppings to choose from, such as "cajun-kraut."  The buns are always fresh and tasty and their daily special weiner/sausage selection is usually really good if they haven't sold out of it by the time you get there.  I would like it if they had a few more dogs with pre-selected topping suggestions, but that's only because I'm too lazy to make decisions sometimes.

data.title: Pricey but good
data.text: 3 of us got 3 dogs an order of fries, 2 beers and a Coke.  $41.  These are high end dogs. I had Kobe beef dog. It was good.  I would have added some mustard and such but if you don't order it that way you have no option. Place is clean but needs some updates.  It's a downtown location so it's kinda quirky. I'd go back but I don't know if I'd make the drive for it.

data.title: Unique Hotdog Experience
data.text: Botsky's did a pre opening offering at Lake Charles' annual Downtown at Sundown series that left me wanting more. I have been many times and have found the hotdogs to be excellent and the service is also very good. It is a very friendly place and the selection of hotdogs extensive. I have never had one I didn't like. For those on a low carb diet, they will wrap your dog in a lettuce or cabbage leaf.

data.title: Destroys other hotdogs!!!
data.text:
Found Botsky's on Yelp and TripAdvisor. Both websites gave it go reviews so why not? Place is clean and staff was friendly. 

Had a smoked dog with onion, pulled pork, mayo, mustard, avocado, and jack cheese. Was pretty awesome looking and it tasted as good as it looked. The wiener has a texture close to sausage but is definitely a wiener. 
Also had a Kobe beef dog with chili, mayo, mustard, and cheese. Presentation was good but the dog was amazingly wonderful. 
The French fries are seasoned with a Cajun blend and are hot and crunchy. Will be going back next time I visit Lake Charles.

data.title: Fantastic hot dogs
data.text: I tried Botsky's for lunch and was blown away by the delicious Kobe hot dog I had topped with pulled pork, pepper jack cheese, creole mustard, jalapeños, and onions.  When I get adventurous enough, I'll have to try a fried egg on top.  Love all the different choices available.  Looking forward to returning again and again until I can try them all.  Bravo!

data.title: Best Hot Dog Joint in Lake Charles
data.text: I had a mac n cheese dog and it was awesome! I have tried a few of the item menus and i havent had anything i didnt like.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: Super friendly, courteous staff. Had a hot dog with chili, mac & cheese, bacon and onions. Aside from the heartburn that I knew would follow, it was as good as I expected. Great spot for a quick bite!

data.title: Skip the hot dog, get the fries.
data.text:
Wife and I were looking for something different in Lake Charles. A friend had mentioned this place, so we decided to try. We looked online to find a menu, but there is none. Wife decided a Chicago Style dog sounded good. Not only don’t they have them, the person taking the order said he never heard of them. 
There is a list of various hot dogs, and multiple toppings. We each had a dog, hers with relish, mine with kraut. 2 dogs, 2 fries, 2 drinks, $25.00! The fries were actually quite excellent. The dogs however were moderately warm, and nothing to write home about. For the money you can find better.

data.title: Hidden gem
data.text: Gourmet hot dogs and Abita beer on tap, what's not to love? We stopped in for a Saturday lunch and it was excellent. Both my Kobe dog and my husband's smoked sausage were delicious. I loved the sweet potato fries as well, so crunchy! But be forewarned, the side items are generous so you might want to share!

data.title: Fun!
data.text: I've been several times and have not been disappointed yet. The menu is unique with something to please everyone. Service has always been good and the dining area clean.

data.title: Good Dogs!
data.text: good place for a variety of dogs-a bit pricy for lake charles-good selection of dogs and toppings-staff very good-good place for a quick lunch-

data.title: Unique Eats!
data.text: Really cool place! House made hot dogs and sausages. Very yummy! A little pricey but it's quality food.  Very unique place.

data.title: Top dog in LCH!
data.text: Stopped in for dinner with a group of 5.  Great décor at this casual spot for hotdogs.  Good location downtown. Dining area and bathrooms are clean. Staff was friendly and helpful.  3 in my party ordered the beef hotdog with mac and cheese among other toppings.  The mac and cheese was a nice touch - loved it!  Hot dog had a good flavor, but the casing on the beef wiener was tough. The Kobe wiener didn't have an issue with tough casing.  The fries were crispy and hot. $50 for our party of 5 - we each ordered a hot dog, fries and a drink. Overall, very good!

data.title: Good hot dogs; close to Interstate.
data.text: Very good dogs; yes you will pay a bit more but the hot dogs will taste very good.  You select from a variety of ingredients and they put together a tasty dog for you.  Location not far from I-10.  A lunch place.

data.title: Great dogs and atmosphere
data.text: Go-to lunch date location for me and my wife.  Love the vibe of the place, good beer on tap, eclectic selection of hot dogs and toppings.
